canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that an alloy or steel type possesses a specific metallurgical structure or phase (e.g., austenitic, ferritic, martensitic) under given conditions.
A microstructural phase, degradation product, or damage mechanism occurs within or is present in a given material or alloy family.
Indicates that two alloy or steel families are conceptually linked because one can exhibit a microstructure similar to that characteristic of the other under certain process or service conditions.
Indicates that two entities can be used in place of one another for the same functional role in a given application context.
Indicates that the subject is a broader class or category that includes the object as a more specific subtype or member category.
Indicates that the subject is a more specific subtype or category within the broader class represented by the object.
Indicates that an alloy or material contains a given chemical element as an intentional alloying constituent in its composition.
Denotes that a material is resistant to, or withstands, a specified corrosion mechanism or general corrosion form under stated conditions.
Denotes that an alloying element or factor increases the resistance of a material to a specified corrosion mechanism or general corrosion form.

Indicates that two entities are co-listed or grouped together as peer categories within the same document structure (e.g., same section or list), without implying causal, hierarchical, or compositional relationships.
Indicates that a process or phenomenon changes the microstructure of a material.
Indicates that a process or transformation produces a specific microstructural feature in a material.
Denotes that the presence or addition of a substance or factor effectively prevents or eliminates a specified degradation process or phenomenon under given conditions.
